etymologies: mid 19th century. From French méthylal or German Methylal, shortened from German Formomethylal from formo- (formo-) + methyl- (in Methylen) + -al (in Acetal)

definitions: Dimethoxymethane, (CH₃ O)₂ CH₂, a colourless, volatile, pungent liquid, used as a solvent and formerly as an anaesthetic.
